text: Gulbrand Alhaug (born July 2, 1942) is a Norwegian onomasticianAlhaug, Gulbrand. 2005. Toril—A Name That Spelled Freedom in 1945. In: Kevin McCafferty et al. (eds.), Contexts—Historical, Social, Linguistic: Studies in Celebration of Toril Swan, pp. 19–29. Bern: Peter Lang. and linguistics professor emeritus at the University of Tromsø.Institutt for språkvitenskap, Universitetet i Tromsø: Alhaug, Gulbrand Alhaug studied at the University of Bergen. He has studied personal names in particular, and published the volume Norsk fornavnleksikon (Dictionary of Norwegian Given Names, 2011). In addition to Norwegian names, his onomastic studies have also included the Pomaks of Bulgaria.Konstantinov, Yulian, Gulbrand Alhaug, & Birgit Igla. 1991. "Names of the Bulgarian Pomaks. Tromso University Working Papers on Language and Linguistics 17: 8–117. ==Selected bibliography== * En datamaskinell undersøkelse av suffiksvekslingen -ing/-ning i moderne norsk (A Computational Study of the Suffix Alternation -ing/-ning in Modern Norwegian; 1973) * Heiderskrift til Nils Hallan på 65-årsdagen 13. desember 1991 (A Festschrift for Nisl Hallan on His Sixty-Fifth Birthday, December 13, 1991; 1991) * Nordisk namnforskning 1997 (Nordic Onomastics 1997; 1998) * 10 001 navn : norsk fornavnleksikon (10,001 Names: Dictionary of Norwegian Given Names; 2001) * Venneskrift til Gulbrand Alhaug (Papers in Honor of Gulbrand Alhaug; 2002) * Fornamn i Noreg frå 1900 til 1975: med vekt på endringar i namnemønsteret (Given Names in Norway, 1900–1975: With an Emphasis on Changes in Name Patterns; 2004) * Mot rikare mål å trå: festskrift til Tove Bull (Aspiring to Higher Things. A Festschrift for Tove Bull; 2005) * Norsk fornavnleksikon (Dictionary of Norwegian Given Names; 2011) ==References== ==External links== *BIBSYS: Publications by Gulbrand Alhaug *University of Tromsø faculty homepage: Gulbrand Alhaug Category:1942 births Category:Living people Category:Linguists from Norway Category:University of Bergen alumni Category:University of Tromsø faculty
